column68: the photographs were also analysed by Dr Robert Nathan at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in California. Nathan
column70: stated that he could find no evidence of a fake.   Certainly
column71: for many who have examined the three images
column72: the first shot is the most impressive. In it
column73: the orange glowing craft can be seen through the windshield of the car
column74: and light from the object is reflected both off the car's bonnet and off the metal guard rail by the side of the road. These
column76: are details that experts claim are extremely difficult to fake. VIDEO EVIDENCE Mexican UFOlogist Jaime maussan was so intrigued by Carlos Diaz's account of his experiences that he provided him with a video camera and asked him to see if he could record the UFO on tape when it next appeared. A few weeks later
column77: Diaz awoke at 5 a.m. and grabbed his camera. he walked out and waited. Apparently
column79: the craft appeared and hovered over the house
column80: where Diaz filmed it. When Maussan saw the remarkable footage
column81: he asked Diaz if he could get even closer to the craft while filming. Two months later
column82: Diaz was once again able to film the craft
column83: which this time hovered directly above him
column84: without moving. However it is Diaz's third attempt to capture the craft on video that is the most spectacular. In this footage
column85: Diaz having mounted his camera on a tripod
column86: walks to the bottom of a field waving a flash light. Responding to this
column87: the craft suddenly materializes directly above Diaz's head and sends beams of light down towards him. Then
column88: the unidentified object remains motionless for 30 seconds
column89: before blinking out. It is universally recognized that this video contains some of the best UFO footage ever taken. source:This article originally appeared in issue 89 of The X Factor. Edited by B J BoothImages edited by UFO Casebook. '
column90: 'Betty Cash and Vicki Landrum were interviewed in 1981 at BergstromAir Force Base. The UFO Casebook has a  transcription  of this taped session.                   Betty Cash
column91: one of three people injured in a UFO close encounter                  near Huffman
column95: died on the 18th                  anniversary of the event
column97: Alabama. She had been in                  poor health ever since the encounter. At the time of the event
column98: Mrs.                  Cash operated her own businesses near Dayton
column100: along with Vickie Landrum and grandson Colby                  Landrum
column101: encountered a huge UFO accompanied by military                  helicopters on a dark road in the east Texas Piney Woods. They                  were exposed to radiation from the object
column102: which caused extreme                  medical problems such as burns
column106: and                  vomiting. Although they and others observed a large number of                  military helicopters along with the UFO
column107: the U.S. Government                  refused to acknowledge the event or assist them in any way.                    After the encounter
column108: Betty Cash was hospitalized and treated for                  burns and the other maladies. The extent of the injuries was so great
column109: she was forced to close her businesses and never worked again. He                  life became a series of hospital stays
column110: many of them in intensive care.                  Eventually
column112: which was successfully treated. In                  November 1998
column113: Mrs. Cash suffered a stroke. On December 29
column115: an unusual turn of events claimed her life.                    Mrs. Cash was a hero in the fight against government UFO                  cover-ups and brought hope to other victims of UFO incidents. She                  was devoted to family and friends and never allowed her illness to                  prevent her from helping others to cope with the trauma of UFO                  close encounters.                                Betty Cash will be missed... but never forgotten.                    Peter A. Gersten Director        In 1981 I represented three People in a lawsuit against the United                  States Government for injuries that resulted from their contact with                  an unusual aerial object. Betty Cash
column116: Vicky Landrum and Colby                  Landrum are the only three People to ever sue our government for                  injuries from a UFO. On the eighteenth anniversary of her                  encounter
column117: Betty Cash died.                    Betty Cash was a warrior and heroine. She fought the US                  government and
column119: showed a spirit and tenacity that will                  now be her epitaph. CAUS and I pay tribute to a very brave                  lady... and a victim of this government's callousness to the rights of                  the individual.  From Peter Gersten
